statement.tex: For what value of $k$ would the following function be continuous at $x=0$ ? \[ \qquad f(x) = \begin{cases} \dfrac{x}{\vert x\vert + 2x^2}, &x\neq 0 \\ k,& x = 0 \end{cases} \]

options.tex:
%text
\[ \qquad \lim_{x\to 0^-} f(x) \neq \lim_{x\to 0^+} f(x) \] As the limit itself does not exist at $x = 0$, therefore \underline\text{no value} of $k$ could make $f(x)$ continuous at $x = 0$ \incorrect \[ \qquad \lim_{x\to 0^-} f(x) = \lim_{x\to 0^+} f(x) = 1 \]
Therefore $f(x)$ would be continuous at $x=0$ if $k =1$%
